alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pinal County; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued February 02 at 2:26AM MST until February 03 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures in the lower 30s expected. * WHERE...Northwest Pinal County and Sonoran Desert National Monument. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...These will be the coldest overnight and early morning low temperatures in weeks. Consider taking actions to protect plants, pets, people, and any pipes that may be susceptible to freezing. Travel with care, especially if any moisture on roadways is able to freeze.
info.instruction: A Freeze Warning means sub-freezing temperatures are imminent or highly likely. These conditions will destroy or damage crops and other sensitive vegetation.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pinal County; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument
